Thank you for the translation waterfalls, i didnt even know this masterpiece existed... who cares about the wrong name. this is great stuff

@Magmom Well if even a handful of people enjoy it, that's enough motivation for me. I'll try to tune out all the negativity. Wish people who blasted newbie translators regularly like that would stop typing comments and get to work translating things themselves. Since they're obviously more advanced human beings, they would no doubt do it at a professional level and raise the bar for the rest of us.
Anyways, much love brother.

@waterfalls This work has been untranslated for years then you came and finally translated it, so fuck all the people saying negative shit about it, people really must be bitches if they are complaining because a translation is not flawless instead of being appreciative that there is a translation in the first place, also the reason why you did it is pretty great I rarely see people doing things with the purpose to spread joy to others and you can be sure as hell I enjoyed it. Thanks for your work
hella dummy thiccccc

@theunknown2001 Just one more thing. I don't copy and paste off GT's translation. I have to re-organize the structure of sentences and correct/research words all the time. So I don't to make it sound like I'm THAT heavily dependant on GT and putting in that little effort.

@theunknown2001 I'm well aware of GT's limitations. It's the best option I had at my disposal with my current level of Japanese. To get to a point where I feel super confident about my Japanese and translations would probably take over a year, which would mean this doujin would go untranslated for yet another year in all likelihood. I was unwilling to do that. ---- You're totally correct about things fitting properly based on small details. However, I'm fairly confident I didn't make any other egregious errors besides Yukari's name. It's a simple story, not heavily dependant on lore. --- I do agree that I could have read character background pages first thoroughly. That's a good suggestion.--- Anyways, thank you for saying it in a respectful, constructive way. I'm not sure if I'll be translating another doujin after all the hate I got anyway, so...

I appreciate your work for the translation and letting us read the story, but please keep in mind that Google translate is pretty bad for translation as it's accuracy is like, 60~80% usually. Translation does take on big and small details throughout the whole story, so i advise you to at least study about japanese grammar and a bit of touhou lore is possible. Thank you <3

Thank you, Magmom. It's nice to see someone say something positive or encouraging. The majority of comments I've gotten across different platforms are hateful, angry that my translation and editing isn't flawless. But the reason I did it in the first place was to spread a little joy to people who enjoy this genre.
TRANSLATED LETS GO
Very good
should add "No Penetration" tag.

Hello, Pluto the translator here. 
--------
Wanted to note that I goofed on Ran's master's name. It's not "Murasaki-sama." It's Yukari Yakumo. My Japanese is weak and I heavily rely on Google Translate. Didn't verify it because I assumed what Google gave me was accurate. I don't know the characters. I don't know why it was so off... ---
So I apologize for fucking that up for people who know Touhou. In hindsight I should have confirmed it. But hey, I'm human. --- The good news is her name is only mentioned 3 times total, and she's largely irrelevant to the story. My hope is that people who like this genre will still enjoy it. --- And I thank you for the kind comments. With my limited Japanese and having to draw each individual Hiragana/Kanji, this took a lot of work. Just look at page 18... --- There'd be no point if everyone hated it and only talked about my errors, like in the e-hentai comments section. That made me sad.
